keyMoments.title: Brook Reveals the Tone Dial
keyMoments.description: Brook opens his skull and reveals he's been carrying a Tone Dial containing his former crew's final recording inside his head for 50 years.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Brook's unwavering commitment to his promise to Laboon and sets up the emotional climax of his backstory.
keyMoments.quote: I keep it in my head at all times. This Tone Dial carries a song - a message to Laboon that we were happy all the way to the end of our journey.

keyMoments.title: Brook Proposes Recording Bink's Sake
keyMoments.description: Knowing his crew will die, Brook suggests recording their final performance on a Tone Dial, betting on his Devil Fruit powers to eventually deliver it to Laboon.
keyMoments.significance: This decision shows Brook's leadership and hope even in the face of certain death, transforming tragedy into a message of joy.
keyMoments.quote: Let's sing one last time and record it on the Tone Dial. If the Yomi Yomi no Mi works and I'm revived, I'll find a way to deliver it to Laboon!

keyMoments.title: The Final Performance
keyMoments.description: Brook plays and sings as his crewmates die one by one, tearfully counting down from quartet to duet to solo until he's the last one alive.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotional moments in One Piece, showcasing Brook's strength and the tragedy of losing everyone he loved.

keyMoments.title: 50 Years of Solitude
keyMoments.description: The episode shows Brook's loneliness over decades of drifting alone in the Florian Triangle, including dream sequences of his dead crewmates.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the psychological toll of Brook's isolation and why joining the Straw Hats is so important to him.

keyMoments.title: Playing Bink's Sake at Thriller Bark
keyMoments.description: Brook plays piano while the Tone Dial recording plays, bringing together past and present as everyone sings Bink's Sake.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Brook finally able to share his crew's legacy with new friends, finding hope and companionship after 50 years alone.

relationships.description: Yorki was Brook's captain in the Rumbar Pirates. Brook deeply respected him and took over as acting captain after Yorki left to protect the crew from disease.

evolutionMoments.description: Yorki entrusts Brook with giving the crew hope before parting ways.

relationships.description: Brook made a promise to Laboon to return after sailing the Grand Line. Even 50 years after his death, Brook remains committed to this promise.

evolutionMoments.description: Brook's entire motivation for surviving 50 years is revealed to be keeping his promise to Laboon.

reveals.information: Brook carried a Tone Dial inside his skull for 50 years containing his crew's final recording
Brook became acting captain after Yorki left the crew due to illness
Brook was the last of the Rumbar Pirates to die, witnessing all his crewmates' deaths
Brook experienced 50 years of complete solitude after his resurrection, dreaming of his dead crewmates

keyMoments.title: Yorki Contracts Disease
keyMoments.description: Yorki, captain of the Rumbar Pirates, is revealed to have contracted an incurable infectious disease along with ten other crewmembers.
keyMoments.significance: This disease sets in motion the tragic events that doom the Rumbar Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Yorki Leaves the Crew
keyMoments.description: Yorki makes the selfless decision to leave with the infected crew members to protect the healthy ones, entrusting Brook with leading the remaining crew.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Yorki's leadership and care for his crew, while marking the beginning of the end for the Rumbar Pirates.
keyMoments.quote: Brook, I want you to give the crew hope. We'll sing together again someday, I promise.

statusHistory.reason: Last seen attempting to cross the Calm Belt while infected with disease
Fate unknown after leaving the Grand Line

relationships.description: Yorki was Brook's captain and trusted him to lead the crew in his absence.

evolutionMoments.description: Yorki entrusts Brook with the crew's morale and future before parting ways.

reveals.information: Yorki was a blond pirate with tattoos on his face and wore a white cowboy hat
Yorki was a selfless leader who prioritized his crew's safety over his own

name.japanese: ミズタ・マダイスキー

keyMoments.title: Dies During Final Performance
keyMoments.description: Mizuta Madaisuki is one of the Rumbar Pirates who dies while performing Bink's Sake.
keyMoments.significance: Part of the tragic final moments of the Rumbar Pirates.

statusHistory.reason: Died from poisoned weapons in the Florian Triangle

reveals.information: Died from poison while performing Bink's Sake with his crew

name.japanese: ミズタ・マワリトスキー

keyMoments.title: Dies During Final Performance
keyMoments.description: Mizuta Mawaritosuki is one of the Rumbar Pirates who dies while performing Bink's Sake.
keyMoments.significance: Part of the tragic final moments of the Rumbar Pirates.

statusHistory.reason: Died from poisoned weapons in the Florian Triangle

reveals.information: Died from poison while performing Bink's Sake with his crew
